paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.demographics: 5 male and 3 female subjects, aged between 38 and 69 years (mean age 50.8 years)
patients.phenotype: diffuse or extensive amyloidosis involving most often the brain together with the spinal cord

individual_records.phenotype_details: gait disturbance, paresis of the lower extremities, voiding dysfunction
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 45-year-old man was admitted to our neurosurgical outpatient clinic with progressive gait disturbance and voiding dysfunction.
The underlying mutation - c381T>G (p.(Ile127Met) - is also carried by his sister and suspected in his maternal grandfather, uncle and cousin.
The underlying mutation - c381T>G (p.(Ile127Met) - is also carried by his sister and suspected in his maternal grandfather, uncle and cousin.
The underlying mutation - c381T>G (p.(Ile127Met) - is also carried by his sister and suspected in his maternal grandfather, uncle and cousin.
The underlying mutation - c381T>G (p.(Ile127Met) - is also carried by his sister and suspected in his maternal grandfather, uncle and cousin.

functional_data.summary: The mutation leads to amyloid fibril deposits in tissues, causing organ dysfunction.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in the family.
variants.additional_notes: The paper discusses multiple cases of TTR mutations, but only the c.381T>G variant is detailed with penetrance data.
key_quotes: The underlying mutation - c381T>G (p.(Ile127Met) - is also carried by his sister and suspected in his maternal grandfather, uncle and cousin.
All patients suffered from diffuse or extensive amyloidosis involving most often the brain together with the spinal cord.

tables_processed.table_caption: Reported cases in the literature with spinal amyloid deposits in hereditary amyloidosis.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR gene and its variants were successfully extracted.
